Engineer Jake Holman arrives aboard the gunboat U.S.S. San Pablo, assigned to patrol a tributary of the Yangtze
in the middle of exploited and revolution-torn 1926 China.
His iconoclasm and cynical nature soon clash with the "rice-bowl" system which runs the ship and the uneasy symbiosis
between Chinese and foreigner on the river. Hostility towards the gunboat's presence reaches a climax
when the boat must crash through a river-boom and rescue missionaries upriver at China Light Mission.
- Written by Martin H. Booda-
